title: First Calligraphy of the Year Gathering
detail_text: <:th_ch0109/>Emma-san, we’re ready to do the first calligraphy of the year<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Thank you, Ruby-chan. Hmm, I wonder what I should write? Have you decided yet, Ruby-chan?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0109/>Ruby was thinking of doing “Funkotsusaishin”. It means, “To do things as hard as you can with all of your might”<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>How wonderful! I want to write that too! What does the kanji look like?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0109/>It’s like this<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>....I think it may be a little bit too hard for me. Is there anything else with easier kanji?<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0109/>Hmm.... Let’s see.... How about “Isshinfuran”? It means, “To focus on one thing and push forward”. Ruby thinks the kanji is easy too<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>I think I can write that one! Not to mention the meaning is also cool. For me, it would mean “To keep moving forward as a school idol”. Thank you, Ruby-chan!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0109/>Ehehe. Then, let’s write it together! After we’re finished, let’s go show it to onee-chan. Onee-chan said that she’s preparing some red bean soup with mochi, so<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0208/>Red bean soup!! Uwaaah.... Even though I need to focus on one thing, I’m already distracted~!<:dt_line_end/><:th_ch0000/>Translated by SIFAStheatre and Idol Story<:dt_line_end/>
